group_1.textLeft: Isabeau became a being capable of granting wishes
and turning people into Magical Girls...
It seems rather strange to me
that you didn't sense any peril in this.

group_1.textRight: Well, that's because you humans
will never truly be able to replace me.

group_1.textLeft: What do you mean by that?

group_1.textRight: Even if you possessed all of the same knowledge@that we have,
your species would never be able to fully@comprehend it all.
How about I give you an example?
"In all inertial systems,@the speed of light is invariable..."
That's one of the fundamental laws of the universe,
but no human has ever been able to understand@and apply this information.
Not Isabeau,
nor even you or your husband,@in spite of all of your wisdom.

group_1.textLeft: So, if someone were to gain the same knowledge@and power as you...
As long as they cannot use it,@you will not see them as a threat.

group_1.textRight: Yes, that's exactly it.
Besides, it's not like she was hostile towards us.
Isabeau wanted to conquer France, England...
Eventually, she wanted to have dominion over
all of the lands and people of Europe...
She took it slowly, step by step,
utilizing two of the things that her wish granted her:
Eternal youth and an immortal body.
She had all of the time in the world.
...Would you like to learn more about the palace?
(It must all be very distressing, to be thrown into an@unfamiliar country with a court full of trickery.)
(I'm sure it makes her anxious.)
(...I need to repay her trust.)
...The most powerful man in the court
is His Majesty King Charles' uncle Philippe,@the Duke of Burgundy...
He is the regent of state,Â
in place of the young king.
He was also the one who pushed for His Majesty@the King to marry you.
Now that King Charles has matured so well,
His Majesty will soon be in charge of the country's@affairs himself!

group_1.textLeft: What if something were to...happen to King Charles?

group_1.textRight: That is... It's a bit difficult to say...
...I suppose most would stand in favor of Lord Louis,@Charles' younger brother.

group_1.textLeft: Is it alright if I ask you more questions?
...This has been very informative. Thank you!

group_1.textRight: No... I merely hope that I have been of some help@to you, Queen Isabeau.
I can think of no higher honor than that.
My only wish...
Is to serve you for as long as I live!

group_1.textLeft: ...If that is truly how you feel,
I might be able to make your wish come true.

group_1.textRight: What...?

group_1.textLeft: Close your eyes, empty your mind,
and pledge your eternal fidelity to me...
